body:
https://youtu.be/bQG7W9sIiTg

Video explains the issue I am having. Even though I delete those files they come back. Anybody knows how to fix this? If you know how to fix labymod files I can send you the file I have as well
body_tagged:

title: Labymod Mods Issue

replies.body:
Eh, what is the problem?

The mod checks if there are these files/folders each time it starts up, and if there aren't any, it's gonna create them with the default values. Why do you care about those two folders? The only way to disable this is by modifying the source code of LabyMod, I guess.
replies.body_tagged:
Eh, what is the problem?

The mod checks if there are these files/folders each time it starts up, and if there aren't any, it's gonna create them with the default values. Why do you care about those two folders? The only way to disable this is by modifying the source code of LabyMod, I guess.

replies.body: Ye I was asking if anybody knows to change the source code. I don’t really know about these kind of stuff.
replies.body_tagged: Ye I was asking if anybody knows to change the source code. I don’t really know about these kind of stuff.

replies.body:
u can't remove those files.
it is possible if you have the source code.

so far i know there isnt an updated source code (only Leaked 1)
replies.body_tagged:
u can't remove those files.
it is possible if you have the source code.

so far i know there isnt an updated source code (only Leaked 1)

reply_to.body: Ye I was asking if anybody knows to change the source code. I don’t really know about these kind of stuff.
reply_to.body_tagged: Ye I was asking if anybody knows to change the source code. I don’t really know about these kind of stuff.

replies.body:
Yeah, you can't modify the source code when you don't have it.

You have two options I can think of:
1) You create or ask someone for a simple background software which keeps checking if there are any new LabyMod files in the .minecraft folder and then automatically deletes them.
2) Decompile LabyMod to get the source code and then modify it.

But why do you need those folders gone permanently anyway? Maybe if we knew why, we could help you?
replies.body_tagged:

2) Decompile LabyMod to get the source code and then modify it.

But why do you need those folders gone permanently anyway? Maybe if we knew why, we could help you?

i found the Source code on my pc (backup LabyMod 3.0 Development)

tell me what u want to be removed and i look into it and remove those files.
